tit.e: Tsubo (a unit of area in old Japanese system of weights and measures originated in China)
Tsubo (a unit of area in old Japanese system of weights and measures originated in China)

sen.j: 坪（つぼ）は、尺貫法による面積の単位。
sen.e: Tsubo ("坪") is one of the units in Shakkanho measurement system, which defines the unit for the area of a space.
Tsubo is a unit of area in old Japanese system of weights and measures.
Tsubo is a unit of area in old Japanese system of weights and measures.

sen.j: 現在は一辺が6尺（1間）の正方形の面積と定義されており、それは約3.3平方メートルに相当する。
sen.e: Today, 1 Tsubo defined the area for 6 Shaku (1 Ken) by 6 Shaku square, which is about 3.3 square meter.
Today, 1 tsubo defined the area of a square, 6 shaku (a unit of length; 1 ken [a unit of length]) on a side, which is about 3.3 square meters.
Today, 1 tsubo defined the area of a square, 6 shaku (a unit of length; 1 ken [a unit of length]) on a side, which is about 3.3 square meters.

sen.j: 同じ面積を歩（ぶ）とも言う。
sen.e: The same area of the space is also defined as "Bu." ("歩")
The same area of the space is also defined as bu (a unit of area)
The same area of the space is also defined as bu (a unit of area)

sen.j: これは中国で生まれたもので、歩の別名として坪という名称ができたものである。
sen.e: The unit "Bu" had been developed in China, while "Tsubo" was later introduced as the alternative of Bu unit.
The unit bu had been developed in China, while tsubo was later introduced as the alternative of bu unit.
The unit bu had been developed in China, while tsubo was later introduced as the alternative of bu unit.

sen.j: 一般には、耕地・林野の面積には歩が、家屋・敷地の面積には坪が使われていた。
sen.e: In general, "Bu" unit was used for measuring the area of arable land, forest and field, while "Tsubo" was used for the area of building sites and houses.
In general, bu unit was used for measuring the area of arable land, forest and field, while tsubo was used for the area of building sites and houses.
In general, bu unit was used for measuring the area of arable land, forest and field, while tsubo was used for the area of building sites and houses.

sen.j: 古代中国の周代に、歩幅2歩分（右足を踏み出し、次に左足を踏み出した時の、起点から踏み出した左足までの長さ）を「歩 (尺貫法)」という長さの単位（身体尺）とした。
sen.e: In ancient China during Zhou Dynasty, "Bu" (Shakkanho) was established as the unit of length, specifying the length of two steps forward. (by stepping forward with right leg first and left leg next, and measuring the travelled distance from the starting point to the left foot--this is a type of unit based on the measurement of human body parts)

In ancient China during Zhou Dynasty, 'bu' (the old Japanese system of weights and measures) was established as the unit of length, specifying the length of two steps forward (by stepping forward with right leg first and left leg next, and measuring the travelled distance from the starting point to the left foot; this is a unit based on the measurement of human body parts [a anthropomorphic units]).

In ancient China during Zhou Dynasty, 'bu' (the old Japanese system of weights and measures) was established as the unit of length, specifying the length of two steps forward (by stepping forward with right leg first and left leg next, and measuring the travelled distance from the starting point to the left foot; this is a unit based on the measurement of human body parts [a anthropomorphic units]).

sen.j: その歩を一辺とする正方形の面積のことも「歩」と呼んだのが面積の単位「歩」の始まりである。
sen.e: The "Bu unit for measuring area" was derived from this "Bu unit for measuring length," as the area defined by 1 Bu length by 1 Bu length was specified as 1 Bu area.
The 'bu' unit for measuring area was derived from that the area of a square, 1 bu on a side is also called 'bu.'
The 'bu' unit for measuring area was derived from that the area of a square, 1 bu on a side is also called 'bu.'

sen.j: このときの1歩（面積）は現在の歩よりも小さな面積であったが、後に6尺四方の面積と定められた。
sen.e: This original 1 Bu area was smaller than today's 1 Bu area; later 1 Bu was redefined as 6 Shaku by 6 Shaku square area.
This original 1 bu area was smaller than today's 1 bu area; later 1 bu was defined as the area of 6 shaku square.
This original 1 bu area was smaller than today's 1 bu area; later 1 bu was defined as the area of 6 shaku square.

sen.j: 明治時代に1尺＝(10/33)メートルと定められたので、1坪＝(10/33×6)2＝約3.305785平方メートルとなる。
sen.e: During Meiji period, 1 Shaku was redefined and specified as 10/33m, therefore 1 Tsubo = (10/33 x 6)2 = about 3.305785 sqm.
During Meiji period, 1 shaku was redefined and specified as 10 over 33 meters, therefore 1 tsubo equals 10 over 33 times 6 times 2, that is, about 3.305785 square meters.
During Meiji period, 1 shaku was redefined and specified as 10 over 33 meters, therefore 1 tsubo equals 10 over 33 times 6 times 2, that is, about 3.305785 square meters.

sen.j: 坪または歩は、尺貫法における面積の基本単位となっている。
sen.e: Nowadays, Tsubo and Bu are the basic Shakkanho units for measuring the area of a space.
Nowadays, tsubo and bu are the base unit of the old Japanese system of weights and measures for measuring the area of a space.
Nowadays, tsubo and bu are the base unit of the old Japanese system of weights and measures for measuring the area of a space.

sen.j: 坪の倍数単位には以下のものがある。
sen.e: There are the following Shakkanho units related with Tsubo unit.
Units of multiples of tsubo are as follows.
Units of multiples of tsubo are as follows.

sen.j: 合
sen.e: Go ("合")
Go (a unit)
Go (a unit)
1 Go is equal to 0.1 Tsubo.
1 go is equal to 0.1 tsubo.
1 go is equal to 0.1 tsubo.

sen.j: 勺
sen.e: Shaku ("勺")
Shaku (勺)
Shaku (勺)
1 Shaku is equal to 0.1 Go
1 shaku is equal to 0.1 go.
1 shaku is equal to 0.1 go.

sen.j: 畝
sen.e: Se ("畝")
Se
Se

sen.j: -- 1畝 30坪 約99.174平方メートル 約1アール(a)
sen.e: 1 Se is equal to 30 Tsubo. It is about 99.174 sqm, therefore 1 Se is roughly 1 a. (are)
1 se is equal to 30 tsubo; about 99.174 square meters, therefore 1 se is roughly 1 are (a).
1 se is equal to 30 tsubo; about 99.174 square meters, therefore 1 se is roughly 1 are (a).

sen.j: -- 1反 10畝 約991.74平方メートル 約10アール
sen.e: 1 Tan is equal to 10 Se. It is about 991.74 sqm. (roughly 10 a)
1 tan is equal to 10 se; about 991.74 square meters (roughly 10 ares).
1 tan is equal to 10 se; about 991.74 square meters (roughly 10 ares).

sen.j: -- 1町 10反 約9917.4平方メートル 約1ヘクタール(ha)
sen.e: 1 Cho is equal to 10 Tan. It is about 9917.4 sqm. (roughly 1 ha)
1 cho is equal to 10 tan; about 9917.4 square meters (roughly 1 hectare).
1 cho is equal to 10 tan; about 9917.4 square meters (roughly 1 hectare).

sen.j: 畝・反・町の値は1アール・10アール・1ヘクタールの値に非常に近いので、面積の単位についてはメートル法への移行はスムーズに行われた。
sen.e: Because the figures of Se, Tan, Cho units are close enough to the figures of 1 a, 10 a and 1 ha, the transition of those area units to metric system went smoothly.
Because the figures of se, tan, and cho units are close enough to the figures of 1 are, 10 ares and 1 hectare, the transition of those area units to metric system went smoothly.
Because the figures of se, tan, and cho units are close enough to the figures of 1 are, 10 ares and 1 hectare, the transition of those area units to metric system went smoothly.

sen.j: ただし、坪（歩）だけはメートル法できりの良い数字で表すことができない。
sen.e: However, only Tsubo (Bu) and its decimal units could not be converted directly by the metric units.
However, only tsubo (bu) itself could not convert into the units of the metric system by integral.
However, only tsubo (bu) itself could not convert into the units of the metric system by integral.

sen.j: そのため、登記の表記においては、メートル法による面積に坪を併記して良いこととされている。
sen.e: Therefore, the description of the area on a registration certificate is still allowed to write in Tsubo figure along with the metric figure.
Therefore, the description of the area on a registration certificate is still allowed to write in tsubo figure along with the metric figure.
Therefore, the description of the area on a registration certificate is still allowed to write in tsubo figure along with the metric figure.

sen.j: また、1坪の面積は一般的に2畳の広さにあたる。
sen.e: 1 Tsubo is equal to 2 Tatami mat space, (2 Jo) which is another common area units used in Japan today.
sen.cmt: 原文に畳の解説がありませんので"Tatami mat"の説明を加えています。
sen.e: 1 tsubo is equal to 2 jo (tatami mat space), which is another common area units used in Japan today.
1 tsubo is equal to 2 jo (tatami mat space), which is another common area units used in Japan today.

sen.j: 坪は日本で生まれた単位であるが、かつて日本の統治下にあった大韓民国や台湾でも使用されている。
sen.e: While Tsubo is the unit produced and developed in Japan, it has been also used in Korea and Taiwan because the unit was introduced and established under the ruling of the former Empire of Japan.
While tsubo is the Japanese origin unit, it has been also used in South Korea and Taiwan because the unit was introduced and established under the ruling of the former Empire of Japan.
While tsubo is the Japanese origin unit, it has been also used in South Korea and Taiwan because the unit was introduced and established under the ruling of the former Empire of Japan.

sen.j: 台湾では、1945年に国民政府が、一部の政府文書を除き坪に変えて平方メートルを使用すると宣言したが、民間では今でも広く使用されている。
sen.e: In case of Taiwan, the government of the Republic of China announced to switch from Tsubo unit to the metric unit in 1945 for its official description of the area of a space except some governmental official documents, although the Tsubo unit is still widely used in general public today.

In case of Taiwan, the government of the Republic of China announced to switch from tsubo unit to the metric unit in 1945 for its official description of the area of a space except some governmental official documents, although the tsubo unit is still widely used in private today.

In case of Taiwan, the government of the Republic of China announced to switch from tsubo unit to the metric unit in 1945 for its official description of the area of a space except some governmental official documents, although the tsubo unit is still widely used in private today.

sen.j: 韓国では1961年の計量法施行によって、公式にはメートル法に移行しているが、不動産の売買には坪を用いる実態があったため、2007年7月施行の改定計量法によって、使用すると罰金が課せられるようになっている。
sen.e: In Korea, the measurement law enacted in 1961 had officially declared to switch from Tsubo unit to the metric description; however, the usage of Tsubo unit was still common in practice for real estate business, thus the government revised the measurement law in July, 2007, imposing a penalty for the usage of Tsubo unit in business purpose.

In South Korea, the measurement law enacted in 1961 had officially declared to switch into the metric system; however, the usage of tsubo unit was still common in practice for real estate business, thus the government revised the measurement law in July, 2007, imposing a penalty for the usage of tsubo unit in business purpose.

In South Korea, the measurement law enacted in 1961 had officially declared to switch into the metric system; however, the usage of tsubo unit was still common in practice for real estate business, thus the government revised the measurement law in July, 2007, imposing a penalty for the usage of tsubo unit in business purpose.

sen.j: 台湾・韓国とも坪の面積は日本と同じである。
sen.e: The area specified by Tsubo unit in Taiwan and Korea is the same as Japanese.
The area specified by tsubo unit in Taiwan and South Korea is the same as Japanese.
The area specified by tsubo unit in Taiwan and South Korea is the same as Japanese.

sen.j: 上述の不動産関連での「坪」の他、職業によって特別の「坪」が使われることがある。
sen.e: There are some other kind of "Tsubo" units in particular field of profession other than the "Tsubo" unit used in the real estate business.
There are some other kinds of 'tsubo' unit in particular fields of profession other than in the previously-mentioned real estate business.
There are some other kinds of 'tsubo' unit in particular fields of profession other than in the previously-mentioned real estate business.

sen.j: 錦などの高価な織物や金箔、印刷、製版では1寸四方の面積を1坪としており、区別のためこれを寸坪という。
sen.e: For measuring an expensive fabric such as brocade of gold foil, or for the fields of printing and photoengraving businesses, a unique Tsubo unit called "Sun Tsubo" ("寸坪") is used, which is defined by the square area in 1 Sun by 1 Sun.

For measuring an expensive fabric such as brocade and gold foil, or for the fields of printing and photoengraving businesses, a unique tsubo unit called sun-tsubo is used, which is defined 1 sun-tsubo as an area in 1 sun square.

For measuring an expensive fabric such as brocade and gold foil, or for the fields of printing and photoengraving businesses, a unique tsubo unit called sun-tsubo is used, which is defined 1 sun-tsubo as an area in 1 sun square.

sen.j: タイル・皮革などについては、1尺四方をもって1坪とし、これを尺坪という。
sen.e: In case of measuring tiles and leather materials, a unique Tsubo unit called "Shaku Tsubo" ("尺坪") is often used, which is defined by the square area in 1 Shaku by 1 Shaku.
In case of measuring tiles and leather materials, a unique tsubo unit called shaku-tsubo is often used, which is defined 1 shaku-tsubo as an area in 1 shaku square.
In case of measuring tiles and leather materials, a unique tsubo unit called shaku-tsubo is often used, which is defined 1 shaku-tsubo as an area in 1 shaku square.

sen.j: 尺坪の変形で、ガラス製造会社や板ガラスを扱う企業などでは、30cm四方の面積（900平方センチメートル）のことをガラス坪と呼ぶ。
sen.e: Among those manufactures and distributors of sheet glass products, a unique Tsubo unit called "Glass Tsubo" is used, which is defined by the square area in 30 cm by 30 cm. (900 square centimetres)

A variation of the shaku-tsubo called glass-tsubo is used in the glass manufacturers and the business handling plate glasses and others, which is defined 1 glass-tsubo as 30 centimeters square (900 square centimeters)

A variation of the shaku-tsubo called glass-tsubo is used in the glass manufacturers and the business handling plate glasses and others, which is defined 1 glass-tsubo as 30 centimeters square (900 square centimeters)

sen.j: 面積の単位ではないが、土砂の体積の単位として6尺立方を立坪（りゅうつぼ）という。
sen.e: Although it is not the unit used for the area of a space, there is a unit used for measuring the volume of earth and sand called "Ryu Tsubo," ("立坪") which is defined by the cubic space in 6 Shaku by 6 Shaku by 6 Shaku.
Other than a unit for the area of a space, there is a unit used for measuring the volume of earth and sand called ryu-tsubo which is defined by the space of 6 shaku cubic.
Other than a unit for the area of a space, there is a unit used for measuring the volume of earth and sand called ryu-tsubo which is defined by the space of 6 shaku cubic.

sen.j: 製紙、印刷業界では、一定面積あたりの紙の重さを坪量（つぼりょう）という。
sen.e: For the paper manufacturing or printing industry, the certain weight of a paper per particular area is specified by the unit called, "Tsubo Ryo." ("坪量")
For the paper manufacturing or printing industry, the certain weight of a paper per particular area is specified by the unit called tsubo-ryo.
For the paper manufacturing or printing industry, the certain weight of a paper per particular area is specified by the unit called tsubo-ryo.

sen.j: 元々の坪量は尺坪あたりの重さを匁で表したもの(3.75 g/0.09183 m² = 40.83 g/m²)であったが、今日では1平方メートルあたりの重さをグラム単位で表したメートル坪量・米坪（べいつぼ）が用いられている。
sen.e: Original "Tsubo Ryo" described the weight of paper per Tsubo Shaku by the weight unit, "Monme," ("匁," which is about 3.75g in metric conversion, therefore the original Tsubo Ryo was 3.75g/0.00918 = 40.83g/sqm) but today's Tsubo Ryo is the unit describing the weight of a paper in gram per 1 sqm, which is now called as "Meter Tsubo Ryo/Bei Tsubo. ("米坪")
sen.cmt: まず、原文で「3.75 g/0.09183 40.83 g/」となっており、説明が途切れていて完結していないようです。一応〜ｇ/sqmとしましたが、不明なため事実確認していただければと思います。
sen.e: Original tsubo-ryo described the weight of paper per tsubo-shaku by the weight unit, monme (or momme; 3.75 grams over 0.00918 square meters equals 40.83 grams/square meters) but today's tsubo-ryo is the unit describing the weight of a paper in gram per 1 square meter, which is now called as meter tsubo-ryo or bei-tsubo.
sen.cmt: 原文には 「3.75 g/0.09183 40.83 g/」とありましたが、ウェブで確認すると「3.75 g/0.09183 m² = 40.83 g/m²」となっており、本来はこちらを使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出し、原文修正しました。また、この式の数値は実際に計算すると異なりますが、原文通りとしました。
sen.e: Original tsubo-ryo described the weight of paper per tsubo-shaku by the weight unit, monme (or momme; 3.75 grams over 0.00918 square meters equals 40.83 grams/square meters) but today's tsubo-ryo is the unit describing the weight of a paper in gram per 1 square meter, which is now called as meter tsubo-ryo or bei-tsubo.
